panels.description: Core node uptime
panels.title: Uptime CT

panels.description: Total SWAP
panels.title: SWAP Total

panels.description:
node_disk_io_time_seconds_total：
The number of milliseconds the disk spends on input/output operations. This value is the accumulated value.（Milliseconds Spent Doing I/Os）

irate(node_disk_io_time_seconds_total[1m])：
Calculate the rate per second: (last value - last previous value) / timestamp difference, that is, the percentage of time that the disk spends on I/O operations in 1 second.

seriesOverrides.alias: md0_% of I/O operations per second
md1_% of I/O operations per second
md2_% of I/O operations per second
md3_% of I/O operations per second
nvme0n1_% of I/O operations per second
nvme1n1_% of I/O operations per second
nvme2n1_% of I/O operations per second

panels.title: CPU usage, disk I/O operations per second take time（%）

panels.description:
Reads completed: Reads per second per disk partition

Writes completed: Number of writes per second per disk partition

IO now Number of input/output requests being processed per disk partition per second
panels.title: Disk read and write rate（IOPS）

panels.description:
Read bytes The number of bits read per second per disk partition
Written bytes The number of bits written per second per disk partition
panels.title: Disk read and write capacity

panels.description:
Read time ms Number of seconds per disk partition read operation

Write time ms Number of seconds spent per disk partition write operation

IO time ms Number of seconds spent per disk partition input/output operation

 IO time weighted Weighted seconds spent per disk partition input/output operation
panels.title: Disk IO read and write time

panels.description:
CurrEstab - TCP connections with current state ESTABLISHED or CLOSE-WAIT

ActiveOpens - TCP average connections that have been converted from CLOSED state to SYN-SENT state (within 1 minute)

PassiveOpens - Directly from LISTEN state The average number of TCP connections to SYN-RCVD state (within 1 minute)

TCP_all oc - the number of TCP sockets allocated (established, applied to sk_buff)

TCP_inuse - in use (listening The number of TCP sockets 

TCP_tw - the number of TCP connections waiting to be closed
panels.title: TCP Connection situation

panels.description: Displays the currently running software version of the Walrus Storage Node.
panels.title: Software Version

panels.description: Indicates if the Walrus Storage Node is active (1) or inactive (0).
panels.title: Status Node

panels.description: Displays the uptime of the Walrus Storage Node.
panels.title: Uptime

panels.description: Displays the current epoch number for the Walrus Storage Node.
panels.title: Current Epoch

panels.description: Displays the chain identifier of the Walrus network.
panels.title: Chain ID

panels.description: Displays the number of shards held by the Walrus Storage Node.
panels.title: Number of Shards

panels.description: Tracks the number of workers handling checkpoint downloads.
panels.title: Active Worker Count

panels.description: Track the latest processed event (highest_finished)
panels.title: Latest processed event

panels.description: Track pending events (pending) - should be near or come to 0 in a healthy system. If it continues to increase, then there is an issue.
panels.title: Pending events

panels.description: Track total persisted events (persisted)
panels.title: Total persisted events

panels.description: Monitors how far behind the local node is compared to the full node.
panels.title: Checkpoint Lag Monitoring

panels.description: Track total downloaded checkpoints.
panels.title: Total Downloaded Checkpoints

panels.description: Track latest downloaded checkpoint.
panels.title: Latest Downloaded Checkpoint

panels.description: Tracks how long GET HTTP requests take on average

targets.expr:
sum(rate(http_request_duration_seconds_sum{method="GET", group="WalrusNode"}[5m])) by (route, method) 
/ 
sum(rate(http_request_duration_seconds_count{method="GET", group="WalrusNode"}[5m])) by (route, method)

panels.title: GET Average HTTP Response Time

panels.description: Tracks how long Other HTTP requests take on average

targets.expr:
sum(rate(http_request_duration_seconds_sum{method!="GET", group="WalrusNode"}[5m])) by (route, method) / 
sum(rate(http_request_duration_seconds_count{method!="GET", group="WalrusNode"}[5m])) by (route, method)

panels.title: Other Average HTTP Response Time

panels.description: Top 5 GET API endpoints by request count.
panels.title: 5 Most Requested GET Endpoints

panels.description: Top 5 other API endpoints by request count.
panels.title: 5 Most Requested Other HTTP Endpoints

panels.description:
Identifies the average request duration for HTTP requests. There are two available queries.
The first query shows the average duration for all requests. The second query highlights the top 5 longest average request durations, helping to identify slowest API endpoints.
panels.title: Average HTTP Request Duration

panels.description:
Identifies the 95th percentile (P95) request duration for HTTP requests, helping to identify slow-performing endpoints. There are two available queries.
The first query shows P95 durations for all requests, providing an overview of typical high-latency requests. The second query highlights the top 5 slowest P95 request durations, making it easier to detect the worst-performing routes.
panels.title: P95 HTTP Request Duration (95th Percentile)

panels.description: Tracks when the Walrus Storage Node goes offline and comes back online over time.
panels.title: Node Status Over Time

panels.description: Tracks the epoch status over time for the Walrus Storage Node.
panels.title: Epoch Status Over Time

panels.description: This panel displays the rate of checkpoints downloaded per second for Walrus Storage Node. The values are dynamically adjusted using rate() to prevent amplitude spikes and provide a real-time view of sync performance. Sudden drops may indicate network or node issues.
panels.title: Checkpoint Download Rate

panels.description: This panel displays the rate of checkpoints downloaded per second over time for the Walrus Storage Node. The values are dynamically adjusted using rate() to prevent amplitude spikes and provide a real-time view of sync performance. Sudden drops may indicate network or node issues.
panels.title: Checkpoint Download Rate

panels.description: It shows the total number of new checkpoints downloaded in the last 5 minutes for the Walrus Storage Node. A higher value means the system is processing checkpoints quickly.
panels.title: Total Checkpoints Downloaded (Last 5m)

panels.description: It shows the total number of new checkpoints downloaded in the last 5 minutes for the Walrus Storage Node. A higher value means the system is processing checkpoints quickly.
panels.title: Total Checkpoints Downloaded (Last 5m)

panels.description: It shows the block cache hit ratio, which indicates how efficiently blocks are being read from cache instead of disk. A higher value (closer to 100%) means more reads are served from cache, improving performance.
panels.title: Block Cache Hit Ratio (%)

panels.description: Displays the average processing time for each event type. The metric is calculated by dividing the total event processing duration by the total number of processed events over a 5-minute window. Higher values indicate slower processing, which may signal performance bottlenecks or system congestion.
panels.title: Average Event Processing Time

panels.description: It shows pending events over time - helps identify potential bottlenecks or issues locally or with the network.
panels.title: Pending events

panels.description: It shows persisted vs. processed events over time - helps identify potential issues with processing or persisting events over time. Correlated to pending events.
panels.title: Persisted vs. Processed Events

panels.description: Displays the currently running software version of the Walrus Publisher component.
panels.title: Software Version

panels.description: Displays the current epoch number for the Walrus Publisher Component.
panels.title: Current Epoch

panels.description:
It shows the average time taken to process spans for each method and span name in the Walrus Publisher component. It is calculated by dividing the total processing time by the total number of spans over a given time window ($__rate_interval).
This helps identify slow spans and potential performance bottlenecks.
panels.title: Average Span Processing Time Publisher

panels.description:
It shows the 95th percentile (P95) span processing time, showing the latency below which 95% of spans complete. 
This helps identify high-latency spans and performance bottlenecks in distributed tracing, highlighting the slowest 5% of span executions.
panels.title: P95 Span Processing Time Publisher

panels.description: Tracks how long GET HTTP requests take on average for the Walrus Publisher component
panels.title: GET Average HTTP Response Time

panels.description: Tracks how long other HTTP requests take on average for the Walrus Publisher component

targets.expr:
sum(rate(http_request_duration_seconds_sum{method!="GET", group="WalrusPublisher"}[5m])) by (route, method) / 
sum(rate(http_request_duration_seconds_count{method!="GET", group="WalrusPublisher"}[5m])) by (route, method)

panels.title: Other Average HTTP Response Time

panels.description: Tracks the epoch status over time for the Walrus Publisher component
panels.title: Epoch Status Over Time

panels.description: It tracks the average latency per span, , representing the time taken for a span to complete.
panels.title: Average Span Latency Publisher

panels.description: Displays the currently running software version of the Walrus Aggregator component.
panels.title: Software Version

panels.description: Displays the current epoch number for the Walrus Aggregator component.
panels.title: Current Epoch

panels.description: Tracks how long GET HTTP requests take on average for the Walrus Aggregator component.
panels.title: GET Average HTTP Response Time

panels.description: Tracks how long other HTTP requests take on average for the Walrus Aggregator component

targets.expr:
sum(rate(http_request_duration_seconds_sum{method!="GET", group="WalrusAggregator"}[5m])) by (route, method) / 
sum(rate(http_request_duration_seconds_count{method!="GET", group="WalrusAggregator"}[5m])) by (route, method)

panels.title: Other Average HTTP Response Time

panels.description: Tracks the epoch status over time for the Walrus Aggregator Node.
panels.title: Epoch Status Over Time

panels.description: It tracks the average latency per span, , representing the time taken for a span to complete.
panels.title: Average Span Latency Aggregator
